Line 10: Line 10:  
Of course, in any society there is a divergence between the notion of how we ought to behave and the reality of how we behave; so there is a difference between hypothetical [[pundit (politics)|pundit]]ry and real morality. He whom we call "moral" is moral only after he behaves in accordance with either (if we take the pluralist stance) our perception of "morality", or (if we accept its existence) in the universal human interest.

He whom we call "moral" is moral only after he behaves in accordance with either (if we take the pluralist stance) our perception of "morality", or (if we accept its existence) in the universal human interest.

==An overview of morality==h
+
==An overview of morality==
     
Views on morality have varied greatly over time, and from culture to culture. Usually, morality applies to fields in which the choices made by individuals express an intention relative to other individuals (even non-members of the society).
